I had tons of fun with this game. Even at full retail price, I'd recommend this game. My only real issue about this game is that it's short- it's VERY short. It only took me 1 hour to finish the story line- which wasn't really much of one. Cosmic DJ is a game where you are a Cosmic DJ and have to save the city from 'Bad Vibes' from the main antagonist (forgot his name). The antagonist destroys all the 'Jamtennas' that provide good vibes to the city. As the cosmic DJ, you must fix these 'Jamtennas' by completing the tasks given. There are 4 Jamtennas you must fix and each Jamtenna offers 4-5 missions where you need to create a song using the tools given and fix the Jamtenna. The gameplay is very fun and energetic. It's not really complicated and can easily be done by a child. One thing I really liked about the game is that after you create your song, the game will mix all of the songs from that one Jamtenna into a remix which you can save as a .mp3 to your computer. You can create cover art while the game converts the remix into a .mp3. You aren't forced to save the songs, if you really don't like it.   Conclusion: If you are hesitant on getting this game, buy it. It's cheap, fun, and will kill time if you need to. 9/10

Disclaimer:  I bought this game for $0.79 during a sale. My review is based on paying this price. If you look to pay significantly more or less for this game, my view point doesn't apply to you as much.    Summary:   Cosmic DJ is a music game that require zero musical experience. The player gets to 'create' music using one very simple tool. To spice things up some, there is a bit of a story driven single player mode that doesn't take itself seriously at all. It managed to get some laughs out of me, but it's silly humor probably isn't for everyone. The game only took me a couple of hours to beat. Apart from the story missions, you can just freely use the music creation tool and everything you do in the game can be exported to MP3s if yuou just have to share with your friends.     The Good:   Cosmic DJ does an amazing job of setting a mood and sticking with it. I quickly learned that the game wanted me to laugh and have fun the whole time and it succeeded in doing such. Knowing absolutely nothing about music will not stop you from enjoying this game. Soundtrack was pretty damn good :D    The Not so Good:   While you can switch the creation tool into 'grid mode' there is very little customization happening. For people who are familiar with music, you get to edit rythym down to sixteenth notes, but the actual notes are locked into 4 tones for every song. I understand that this is to make it easy for everyone, but I felt like I was missing out on some really cool stuff because of how limited I was. It seems like just a little bit of work could really turn that around.     The Verdict  : 7/10 -3 for lack of depth. I felt like Cosmic DJ could have really impressed me and drawn me in for a few more hours but missed the mark. But, for $0.79, it's hard to go wrong with Cosmic DJ.
